pullrequest.title: Load SDF 1.7 even if there are errors

content.raw: Works great for me! This doesn't actually disable frame semantics if there is an error during load. Instead, whenever `common::resolveSdfPose` is called, it might fail depending on the type of error encountered during `*::Load`. For example, the `<script>` error won't prevent frame semantics from working. I think this is a good thing, but I can see how it can be confusing for users if they see different poses depending on what type of error they have in their sdf file. Maybe we can say "Pose frame semantics may not work as expected" or something to that effect if there are any errors during `*::Load`.
content.html: Works great for me! This doesn't actually disable frame semantics if there is an error during load. Instead, whenever common::resolveSdfPose is called, it might fail depending on the type of error encountered during *::Load. For example, the <script> error won't prevent frame semantics from working. I think this is a good thing, but I can see how it can be confusing for users if they see different poses depending on what type of error they have in their sdf file. Maybe we can say "Pose frame semantics may not work as expected" or something to that effect if there are any errors during *::Load.
